description.narrative: To improve access to basic services, enhance resilience and strengthen integrated urban planning and management in the City of Kigali and the six secondary cities of Rwanda.

condition.narrative: The GoR shall cause REMA within 30 (thirty) days after the Effective Date of the Financing Agreement to execute MoUs with each ofRLMUA for the execution of the LiDAR survey under component 1(b) of the Project and RWB for the provision of technical and advisorysupport to REMA on wetland restoration and rehabilitation and health monitoring under component 1(b) of the Project.

The GoR shall cause each Target Secondary City to within thirty (30) days after the Effective Date of the Legal Agreementsestablish and maintain, throughout Project implementation, a TSC Project Implementation Unit (TSC-PIU) with adequate resources andfacilitation and composed of key staff, with qualifications, experience and under terms of reference acceptable to the Association.

The GoR shall cause the CoK and RWB within 30 (thirty) days after the Effective Date of the Legal Agreements to execute aMemorandum of Understanding (MoU) for the provision by RWB of technical support to the CoK for implementation of flood risk andwetland management under component 1(a) of the Project.

The GoR shall within thirty (30) days after the Effective Date of the Financing Agreement, GEF Grant Agreement, SCF-PPCR LoanAgreement and Project Agreements with REMA and LODA (the “Legal Agreements”) establish and maintain throughout Projectimplementation the National Steering Committee (“NSC”).
The GoR shall within thirty (30) days after the Effective Date of the Legal Agreements establish and maintain throughout Projectimplementation a Project Technical Committee (“PTC”).

The Recipient shall cause each Target Secondary City and the CoK, prior to commencement of infrastructure upgrading in eachsettlement, to establish and maintain throughout Project implementation, Community Upgrading Committees (“CUCs”) composed of keypersonnel under terms of reference acceptable to the Association.

Hotspots rehabilitated with flood risk reduction interventions
Institutional and capacity development plans developed
Cities with detailed area plans, incorporating principles of sustainability, prepared and adopted

Beneficiaries participating in consultations who consider that their needs are reflected in project investments (disaggregated by gender)

Standalone drains constructed or rehabilitated under the project
Urban roads constructed or rehabilitated under the project
Feasibility studies for disposal facilities prepared
Greenhouse gas accounting and reporting framework developed and operational
National sites and services strategy developed and implemented
National urbanization strategy developed and urbanization monitoring information system operational
Roadmap for City Management Offices developed
